original: Bergqvist, Nils Gunnar, praktiserande läkare, Göteborg, f. 4/2/98 i Härnösand av rektor Johan B. o. Alida Holstén. G. 1. 26 m. med. lic. Ruth" Holmquist, d. 32; 2. 40 m. Margaretha Lundin, f. Bjerkén. Barn: Birgitta (adopt:dtr), Nils Göran. — Stud:ex. 17, med. kand. 22 o. med. lic. 30, allt i Lund. E. läk. v. kir. klin. i Lund 25, v. med. klin. där 26, vik. e. läk. v. venereolog. avd. o. poliklin. f. könssjukd. i Lund 27 o. 28, e. läk. där 29 o. 30, därund. tf. överläk. o. förest, f. poiliklin. fem mån., e. läk. v. Lunds las. radiolog. avd. 31, vik. bitr. läk. v. Holtermanska sjukh. o. dess poHklin. 31-32, bitr. läk. där samt läk. v. poliklin. f. hud- o. könssjukd. 32-34, und:läk. 34-38, därund. tf. över-läk. nio mån., prakt. läk. i Gbg sed. 38.
translated: Bergqvist, Nils Gunnar, practicing physician, Gothenburg, b. February 4, 1898 in Härnösand to the rector Johan B. and Alida Holstén. Married 1st in 1926 to medical licentiate Ruth Holmquist who died in 1932; 2nd in 1940 to Margaretha Lundin, nee Bjerkén. Children: Birgitta (adopted daughter), Nils Göran. Educated at the student exams in 1917, medical candidate in 1922, and medical licentiate in 1930, all in Lund. Worked as assistant physician at the surgical clinic in Lund in 1925, assistant physician at the medical clinic there in 1926, temporary assistant physician at the venereology department and the polyclinic for sexually transmitted diseases in Lund in 1927 and 1928, physician there in 1929 and 1930, thereafter acting senior physician and head of polyclinic for five months, physician at the radiology department of Lund Hospital in 1931, temporary assistant physician at Holterman Hospital and its polyclinic from 1931 to 1932, assistant physician there as well as physician at the polyclinic for skin and sexually transmitted diseases from 1932 to 1934, junior physician from 1934 to 1938, and thereafter acting senior physician for nine months. Practicing physician in Gothenburg since 1938.

memberOf.name: Polyclinic for Sexually Transmitted Diseases, Lund
Polyclinic for Skin and Sexually Transmitted Diseases
